New Records: Jan Vertonghen diverted Randal Kolo Muani’s harmless shot into his own goal, securing France’s 1-0 win over Belgium and a spot in the Euro 2024 quarter-finals
Key Match Events: Randal Kolo Muani scored the winning goal after his shot was deflected off Jan Vertonghen and into the net
Kylian Mbappe was crowded out and unable to make a significant impact on the game
Belgium's De Bruyne was largely reduced to safe balls at the base of midfield
Pre-Game Insights: France's coach Didier Deschamps emphasized the importance of getting to the quarter-finals, regardless of the team's performance
Belgium's manager Domenico Tedesco seemed intent on outdoing Deschamps in the dourness stakes, leaving his team to focus on defense
Post-Match Reflections: France's win was described as 'dour obduracy' rather than any creativity or class
Belgium's performance was criticized for being too defensive and lacking in innovation
France's next round will dictate a lot, and they may continue to underwhelm but be hard to beat
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was described as 'the worst football in this tournament' outside of England's games
France's goal was preceded by a clever angled pass from Antoine Griezmann, but it was the only notable moment of creativity in the game
Others: France's approach to the game was compared to Germany in the 1980s and 1990s, who were known for their resolve and ability to make the latter rounds despite not being a popular team to watch
